<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 118, 379, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 194, 332, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 170, 905, 186]]<|/det|>
0625/11  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 194, 905, 210]]<|/det|>
May/June 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[814, 217, 905, 232]]<|/det|>
45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 247, 507, 263]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 277, 437, 285]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 286, 544, 317]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 337, 227, 352]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 353, 115, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>OR</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[129, 353, 599, 368]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 368, 907, 399]]<|/det|>
For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D. Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 399, 579, 414]]<|/det|>
Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 415, 277, 429]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 430, 868, 460]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 460, 327, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 476, 364, 491]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 492, 329, 507]]<|/det|>
You may use a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 507, 680, 523]]<|/det|>
Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(9.8\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 549, 220, 564]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 565, 570, 615]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 40. Each correct answer will score one mark. Any rough working should be done on this question paper.

massweight
Aboth objects have the same massboth objects have the same weight

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 641, 465, 660]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 451, 868, 470]]<|/det|>

<label>A</label>

<label>20</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 764, 700, 784]]<|/det|>

Every reasonable effort has been made by the publisher (UCLES) to trace copyright holders, but if any items requiring clearance have unwittingly been included, the publisher will be pleased to make amends at the earliest possible opportunity.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 880, 920, 912]]<|/det|>
To avoid the issue of disclosure of answer-related information to candidates, all copyright acknowledgements are reproduced online in the Cambridge Assessment International Education Copyright Acknowledgements Booklet. This is produced for each series of examinations and is freely available to download at www.cambridgeinternational.org after the live examination series.
